channel.title: New local problems on FixMyStreet
channel.description: The latest local problems reported by users

item.title: Nuisance tree, 20th August
item.description:
See reports 8032793 8032793 I would like to speak to someone who deals with trees I do not as a ratepayer expect to be ignored by the council the situation needs and continue only to recieved auto generated replys,this tree has not been inspected if it has please tell me when this was ,or I will be taking it further. I expect some action on this before there is further problems.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): Eden Way, Eden Park, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: 21 University Street, 20th August
item.description:
The street light outside the main entrance to UCL's Rockefeller Building is missing the top half. It is impacting on people with visual impairments who need the street light to be able to access UCL's buildings and navigate their way around.
Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 21, University Street, Fitzrovia, London

item.title: Dear local aerial manager could you please address this issue last year summer 2023. where a resident who lives at number 3 daintry way E9 5JJ has been going around the Daintry way courtyard with a jet washer washing all the paving stones with a high pressure rised jet washer which has made all paving stones come loose because all the sand and grout has been jet washed at high pressure causing it to come loose and wobbly. The local aerial manager Denise Corbin is aware and she even praised resident on a good job making the area nice But she doesn't realise the damage the resident has caused by making all the paving stones loose now.Hackney council would have to pay to get paving stone relayed reset fixed. Causing problems for elderly residence who cannot walk properly. by stumping their feet on the paving stones and tripping over then have to call for a local ambulance to help the resident in distress up. putting the strain on the ambulance service. Dear Denise Corbin please get your act together. May need further training in her career to benefit residents. Hackney Council passing the buck and not wanting to do their job or pay for the work to be done as usual negligence., 20th August
item.description:
This is Hackney Council public land and the paving stones are loose they need to pay to get this done it's not a private quote. Elderly vulnerable people are tripping over and getting themselves hurt waiting for NHS ambulance is to help them up.

Nearest address to the pin placed on the map (from OS Places API): Daintry Way, Hackney, London
Report on FixMyStreet

item.title: Street bins located too close to a bus stop, 20th August
item.description:
This morning I saw a nice looking bin placed by a bus stop and with lots of rubbish next to it . Why has a bin been placed so close to a busy bus stop with so much space on the other end ? When waiting for the bus the rubbish was blown by the wind and the smell of the waste . Can this bin be relocated ?

Nearest road to the pin placed on the map (automatically generated by OpenStreetMap): 228, Shirland Road, Kensal Town, London
Report on FixMyStreet
